snippet: Colin Myler, editor of The Daily News and former editor of The News of the World, was targeted in a British parliamentary panel’s report on the phone-hacking scandal.
abstract: British parliamentary panel's report on the News Corporation phone-hacking scandal concludes that Daily News editor Colin Myler misled them about his knowledge of the illegal behavior, putting him at risk of being cited for contempt of Parliament; Myler, a British citizen, was editor of News of the World until it was closed in 2011.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: Colin Myler, editor of The Daily News and former editor of The News of the World, was targeted in a British parliamentary panel’s report on the phone-hacking scandal.

headline.seo: Colin Myler, Daily News Editor, Back in Spotlight With Phone-Hacking Report
headline.main: With Report, a Tabloid Editor Is Again Part of the Story
headline.print_headline: With Report, a Tabloid Editor Is Again Part of the Story

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
